# AppExtensionIdentity

**Structure**

A type that uniquely identifies an app extension on the system.

## Declaration

```swift
struct AppExtensionIdentity
```

## Overview

Use this type to identify an app extension on the system and connect to it. You don’t create this type directly. Instead, you use the [doc://com.apple.extensionfoundation/documentation/ExtensionFoundation/AppExtensionPoint/Monitor] type to retrieve instances of this type for the available app extensions.

## Identifying the process

- **bundleIdentifier**: The bundle identifier of the app extension.
- **extensionPointIdentifier**: The extension point of your host app that the app extension supports.
- **localizedName**: The localized, human-readable name of the app extension.

## Comparing app extensions

- **hash(into:)**: Hashes the essential components of the extension by feeding them into the given hash function.
- **==(_:_:)**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether two identities are equal.

## Deprecated

- **AppExtensionIdentity.Availability**: An object that contains information about available extensions.
- **availabilityUpdates**
- **matching(appExtensionPointIDs:)**: The asynchronous sequence of extension identities which target the specified extension point identifiers.
- **AppExtensionIdentity.Identities**: An asynchronous sequence that returns the enabled extensions that match provided constraints.

## Host-app configuration

- **Discovering app extensions from your app**: Find the app extensions that match your host app’s extension points and are available to use.
- **AppExtensionProcess**: A type the host app creates to launch and manage an app extension.

## Conforms To

- Equatable
- Hashable
- Identifiable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
